author: Ashitha Nagesh For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Massive protests in Anaheim after police officer 'tries to shoot kids' | Metro News
text:
Ashitha Nagesh for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 8:08 am He â€˜scuffledâ€™ with the young teens (Picture: YouTube) 
An off-duty police officer was filmed almost shooting young teenagers near his home in California, sparking huge protests on the streets of the city. 
In disturbing footage, the officer confronted a group of kids whom he accused of walking on his front garden. 
The confrontation escalated, with the officer scuffling first with one boy â€“ 13-year-old Christian Dorscht â€“ and then with the entire group of kids, who were all unarmed. He then fired a shot, sending the children running away. 
At one point Christian can be heard saying â€˜Iâ€™m only 13â€™, as the others keep telling the officer to â€˜let him goâ€™. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video The kids were around 13 years old (Picture: YouTube) 
Soon afterwards, however, more officers arrived on the scene and detained the children. Two of them were arrested. Family of nine 'gang raped drunk woman for two hours as she pleaded for them to stop' 
The officer, who is as yet unnamed, claims that one of the kids threatened to â€˜shootâ€™ him â€“ however, that teenager says he actually threatened to â€˜sueâ€™ him. The teens also say the officer called a girl who was walking on the garden a â€˜c*ntâ€™. 
The shocking incident took place in Anaheim at around 2.40pm on Tuesday. 
Protesters then took to the streets on Wednesday, chanting â€˜Whose streets? Our streetsâ€™, â€˜Donâ€™t shoot our kidsâ€™, â€˜Shame on youâ€™, and â€˜No justice, no peace, fuck the policeâ€™.

Late on Wednesday night the boyâ€™s father, Johnny Dorscht, said he was â€˜pretty pissed off about what happenedâ€™. Teenagers almost died in frozen lake after falling through ice taking selfies 
â€˜You could talk to anybody, my son has very good manners,â€™ he told local paper Orange County Weekly. 
â€˜He does good in school and isnâ€™t disrespectful or anything like that. Weâ€™re going to find legal representation and be suing. This is BS. 
â€˜Even the cops, when they got there, they had all the kids down. They didnâ€™t even go after the guy.â€™ Protesters â€“ including children â€“ demonstrated outside the copâ€™s house in Anaheim (Picture: AP) 
Christianâ€™s mum Alma Jimenez addressed protesters in a video posted to her Facebook page. 
â€˜You almost killed my child,â€™ she said, referring to the police officer. â€˜Stop shooting our kids. This is my son â€“ he is 13 years old, he was not armed. 
â€˜He [the officer] was. He pulled out, he reached for his weapon, he intended to use it.â€™ People are demanding a fair investigation (Picture: AP) 
Anaheim Mayor Tom Tait assured protesters there would be a â€˜thorough, impartialâ€™ investigation into the incident. 
â€˜Like many in the community, Iâ€™ve seen the video and Iâ€™m very concerned about what it shows,â€™ he said, according to ABC7. 
â€˜Anaheim is committed to a full and impartial investigation. Our city will move forward without delay.â€™ More
